title: Palau national football team
text:
The Palau national football team represents <a href="Palau">Palau</a> in international <a href="Association%20football">football</a>. The team is not affiliated with <a href="FIFA">FIFA</a> or a local confederation. The team play their home games at the <a href="National%20Stadium%20%28Palau%29">PCC Track and Field Stadium</a> in the town of <a href="Koror%20City">Koror City</a>.
History.
Palau hosted and competed in the <a href="Micronesian%20Games">Micronesian Games</a> in 1998, in which they finished third. In the tournament, teams were 9-a-side and the matches were 80 minutes in duration and were played on a pitch which was below regulation size. In addition to their first team, Palau also fielded a team consisting of <a href="Bangladeshis">Bangladeshis</a> living on the island. They reached the final in the <a href="Micronesian%20Games">Micronesian Games</a> in 2014, where the team's trip was partly covered by internet <a href="crowd%20funding">crowd funding</a>.
Competitive record.
OFC Nations Cup.
The Palau national football team was affiliated with <a href="Oceania%20Football%20Confederation">OFC</a> between 2007 and 2009. It is currently not a member of OFC.
Results.
"Palau's score is shown first in each case."
Head-to-head record.
"Up to matches played on 23 July 2018."
